intro: Phyllanthus lindenianus subsp. jimenezii, commonly known as the Mexican waterleaf, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically lobed and have a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
